title: Mavs Suffer 4-0 Defeat to SMU in Dueling Tennis Action
text:
Mavs Suffer 4-0 Defeat to SMU in Dueling Tennis Action
The UT Arlington women's tennis team suffered a 4-0 defeat against SMU in their second match of the season. The Mustangs secured the doubles point quickly, winning on Court 3 by forfeit and finishing off Court 2 with a 6-3 victory. In singles play, SMU clinched the match with decisive wins, including a forfeit on Court 6 and two straight-set victories. UTA was competitive in several matches, but ultimately the match concluded without completing all contests.
- SMU secured 4 match wins to UTA's 0.
- UTA lost the doubles point with a forfeit on Court 3 and a 6-3 loss on Court 2.
- SMU took early control with the doubles point, setting the tone for singles play.
- Several matches for UTA were not finished, indicating competitive moments despite the overall result.
UT Arlington will host their home opener with two matches this weekend against Cowley at 10 a.m. CT and Dallas Baptist at 2 p.m. at the UTA Tennis Center, aiming to bounce back from this loss.
Bottom LineThe Mavs must regroup quickly and leverage their home-court advantage in upcoming matches to gain confidence and secure their first win of the season.
Read more at University of Texas Arlington Athletics
